author: Special Correspondent
text:
Dozens of workers protested at the Government Stanley Hospital on Monday morning, as their Pongal bonus had not come through on Friday.

Hospital dean Isaac Christian Moses said there had been a delay – “The bills were sent in by Thursday, but they have to go through the treasury office in order to be cleared. We were hoping it would happen by Friday, but it did not happen on time. They were expecting it on the day of the festival but it was delayed by a couple of days.”

He added: However, the bonus came through even while the workers were protesting.

“The issue has been resolved now he said.
title: Protest at Stanley Hospital
